data.text:
2024 Football Roster

Choose a Player:

1 Cam Ross

Year Redshirt Senior

Position Wide Receiver

Ht./Wt. 5-10 / 181

Hometown Newark, Del.

High School St. John's College

Previous UConn

Major Professional and Continuing Education

Bio

Related

Stats

Biography

Prior to JMU:

Transferred to JMU after four seasons at UConn (2019-23)

Played in 28 career games for the Huskies

Tallied 114 receptions for 1,356 receiving yards and six touchdowns

2019 Pro Football Focus Honorable Mention Freshman All-American

Played 12 games in 2023, making 44 catches for 552 yards and two touchdowns while also rushing for nine yards

Also averaged 16.3 yards per kick return and 6.2 per punt return in 2023

Had two catches for 21 yards while an injury limited him to three games in 2022

Recorded eight catches for 60 yards and averaged 11.0 yards per punt return, as a season-ending injury held him to just two games in 2021

Made 60 receptions for 723 yards and four touchdowns while rushing for 27 more in 2019

Played JMU once previously, recording four catches for 91 yards with a long of 44, as well as a 27-yard kickoff return on Nov. 11, 2023

Two career 100-yard games at UConn

Two career catches over 50 yards at UConn, including career-long 94-yarder vs. ECU (2019)

Career-high nine receptions vs. Houston (2019) and at UMass (2019)

Career-high 169 receiving yards vs. ECU (2019)

Career-high two receiving touchdowns vs. ECU (2019)

Career-long 27-yard kickoff return at JMU (2023)

Career-long 19-yard punt return at Fresno State (2021)

Career-long 14-yard rush vs. USF (2023)

High School:

2018 Washington Post Second Team All-Metro

2018 USA Today All-USA DC Second Team

2018 First Team All-Washington Catholic Athletic Conference and Honorable Mention in 2017

Accumulated over 2,000 all-purpose yards and 18 touchdowns in career

Helped St. John’s College to WCAC championship in 2017

Played 2015 and 2016 seasons at St. Elizabeth School in Wilmington, Del., earning 2016 First Team All-Delaware Catholic Conference honors both at wide receiver and return specialist

Personal:

Son of Sheila Dean Ross and Gerald Ross III

Has two brothers, Brandon and Jarrett

Both of his brothers played football at Maryland, with Brandon playing 2011-15 and Jarrett 2013-16

Graduated from the University of Connecticut with a bachelor’s degree in finance in December 2022
